tool.name: Cactus
tool.command:
cat $aln_mode.in_tree >> seqfile.txt &&
## set up seqfile #for $seq in $aln_mode.in_seqs: #set seq_fn = str($seq.label) + '.' + $seq.fasta.ext ln -s '$seq.fasta' '$seq_fn' && printf '%s %s\n' '$seq.label' '$seq_fn' >> seqfile.txt && #end for
cat seqfile.txt &&
cactus ./jobStore ./seqfile.txt ./alignment.hal --root mr --binariesMode local --workDir ./
## what are these for? ## hal2fasta HALFILE $(halStats --root HALFILE) --subtree --upper > gfatemp.fa ## hal2paf HALFILE --hdf5InMemory --onlySequenceNames > gfatemp.paf ## seqwish -p gfatemp.paf -s gfatemp.fa -g out.gfa
## if assemblyhub output ## hal2assemblyHub.py WORKDIR HALFILE OUTDIR
## if pangenome (.pg) output ## hal2vg input.hal --hdf5InMemory --chop 32 --progress > output.pg

param.name: aln_mode_select
param.label: Alignment mode
param.help: The taxonomic relationship between input genomes. If genomes are within a single species, select 'Within-species'

param.name: in_tree
param.label: Guide tree
param.help: Phylogenetic tree in Newick format. Used by Cactus to achieve linear scaling with number of input genomes

param.name: label
param.label: Genome Label
param.help: NO SPACES. Must be same name as appears in guide tree
